commitResults.messageTitle: Change name to Marvin. Update README.
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename old name Duke to Marvin, after Marvin the Paranoid Android
from the Hitchhiker's Guide to The Galaxy. Also update README
with the name and short description.

Marvin replies with any command inputted by a user.
"bye" command exits the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add task list and ability to add to list
Fix bug preventing sentences from being read
Refactor tasklist into its own class
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasklist in Marvin uses an array of strings to hold the tasklist.

To account for evolving requirements (todos, deadlines), encapsulating
behaviour of the tasklist is desirable as it grows in complexity

Create a class TodoList to hold the list and associated methods. Create
Todo class to keep Todo-related functions together. Refactor Marvin to
use the TodoList and Todo classes in its operations.

Todos have no ability to be set as done or not.

2 new commands, mark, unmark allow for this.

commitResults.messageTitle: TodoList: rename to TaskList, introduced Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
TodoList holds a Todo array. To enable multiple task types
and polymorphism, created abstract task class.

Change array type in TodoList to a Task array. Rename
TodoList to TaskList to accurately reflect held objects.
Made Todo extend Task

Using the abstract class is preferrable as common methods
(marking tasks) can have 1 common implmentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Deadline, Event class. Added new operations
commitResults.messageBody:
Marvin can only add Todos to the tasklist

Introduce Deadline and Event classes and ability to add them to the
list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to work with tests
commitResults.messageBody:
Main throws NoSuchElementException due to scanner
reading past EOF on piped inputs.

Main checks if hasNextLine before reading input
to prevent the exception from occuring

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList: Refactor to use ArrayList instead of array
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList uses an array of tasks to hold values.

Arrays are restricted by size - arraylists allow for
dynamic sizes and facilitates an easier delete operation

Replaces array with ArrayList from the Collections library

Tasks can only be added

Users should be able to fully manage tasks, including
deletion

Implemented task deletion

Data is lost after user closes marvin.

Persisting tasks even after closing is desired
as users will be able to keep marvin closed
if they don't need it currently.

Lets
* Add a storage handler class to handle data files
* Make tasklists and tasks serializable to save
* Make marvin load on startup and save after
    every operation

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify deadline to use DateTime objects
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline objects use Strings to store dates.

To allow extra functionalities based on date
operations, make Marvin use LocalDateTime
to parse user input and store as a date object.

Deadline/Events only store LocalDate without time

Change classes used to store date to LocalDateTime

All UI/Personality/Color related code is stored in Main

For greater OOP and ease of reading, extract them
into 3 new classes.

Commands are handled in a large while loop in Marvin main.

To enhance maintainability and ease of reading, create
abstract command class with concrete commands implementing
execute.

Marvin parses commands in the main while loop. Create a parser
class to parse command and create the corresponding user
command.

Marvin is packageless. Create duke package along with
command, task, ui packages to group related classes.

build.gradle points to old class name, updated to
Marvin. Renamed package to Marvin.

commitResults.messageTitle: Format code to adhere to standard

commitResults.messageBody:
Lets
* Add a find command class
* Add a method in tasklist to search
* Add a clause in parser for the find command
* Update personality with more quips for this

commitResults.messageTitle: Add additional JavaDoc comments on public methods
Update JavaDoc for TaskList to comply with format
commitResults.messageBody:
JavaDoc comment for search tasks failed to terminate with
period. Add 3 periods at the end of each JavaDoc sentence
to comply with code style.

There are several violations of the coding standard in the code,
mostly in missing JavaDoc comments for classes. To comply
with standard and make reading the code easier,
Lets
* Add missing JavaDoc comments
* Fix some indentation
* Rename some variables
PR reviewer suggests adding an edge case for the tests.
Incorporate changes up to part 4 of the JavaFX SE-EDU guide

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Command behaviour to allow GUI usage
commitResults.messageBody:
Command:execute executes a given command and then prints a message
out to the Ui.

With the introduction of the GUI, there needs to be a mechanism
to obtain a string-based reply from Marvin. Additionally, there
cannot be any terminal color codes encoded into the string, and
there should still be CLI support for the user.

Let's,
* Introduce a CommandResult class to encapsulate both printable
    output for the CLI and raw output for the GUI
* Modify Command and subclasses to return CommandResult
* Modify CLI run to include a call to CommandResult::printResponse
    to print out the information to the CLI
* Introduce extra methods in Personality to return uncolored
    output for the use of GUI display
Update code to comply with CheckStyle. Mostly formatting changes.
Use CSS styles to add more flair to the GUI

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions in key parts of code
commitResults.messageBody:
Several methods have implicitly-assumed postconditions
or preconditions.

Inserting assertions to test these assumptions increases
chance of catching bugs earlier.

Let's:
* Update build.gradle to enable assertions on runs
* Add assertion in storage handler to ensure save file writes
* Add assertions in parser to check preconditions
* Add assertions in TaskList to check postconditions of operations

commitResults.messageTitle: Make happy path clearer in command package
commitResults.messageBody:
DeleteTask and MarkTask have "happy path" concealed in
try blocks

To make code clearer and more understandable, extract
return statements and happy-path code out from try block.

Code in task package can be improved in terms of readability.

Let's:
* Introduce section breaks to improve reading flow
* Adhere to DRY principle by extracting repeated ToString
    logic into parent class Task
* Improve string builder append presentation to make
    obvious the desired output from chained statements

Parser code includes practices and standards that harm
understandability.

To adhere to DRY principle and the SLAP,

Let's:
* Extract common validation code into a function
* Extract common user-input regex matching code into a function
* Extract common date-parsing code into a function
* Adhere to single level of abstraction in functions

commitResults.messageTitle: Color: Extract magic string into variable.

commitResults.messageBody: Add assertions in key parts of code
Branch-A-CodeQuality

To faciliatate this Let's,
* update display of tasks to include tasks to be
    done first to point to tasks to be done later
* Add a new DoAfter command, together with its
    parsers and command logic
* Track which tasks are connected to each other
* Use string-based locators instead of index
    to uniquely identify tasks. For example,
    "1.3" would refer to the third do-after
    task of the first task
